purpose: Filters blood to produce urine, removes liquid waste, and maintains fluid and electrolyte balance.

interfaces.name: Blood Filtration
interfaces.description: Receives blood from cardiovascular system for filtration and waste removal. Verified by physiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, PubMed)

interfaces.name: Waste Removal Coordination
interfaces.description: Coordinates with digestive system for removal of solid and liquid waste. Verified by physiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, PubMed)

verification_notes: Based on established anatomical and physiological sources.

justification.rationale: Standard anatomical model; all interfaces are well-documented in literature.
